register_archive.hpp

00003 // file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00004 #ifndef BOOST_ARCHIVE_DETAIL_REGISTER_ARCHIVE_DWA2006521_HPP
00005 # define BOOST_ARCHIVE_DETAIL_REGISTER_ARCHIVE_DWA2006521_HPP
00006 
00007 namespace boost { namespace archive { namespace detail { 
00008 
00009 // No instantiate_ptr_serialization overloads generated by
00010 // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_REGISTER_ARCHIVE that lexically follow the call
00011 // will be seen *unless* they are in an associated namespace of one of
00012 // the arguments, so we pass one of these along to make sure this
00013 // namespace is considered.  See temp.dep.candidate (14.6.4.2) in the
00014 // standard.
00015 struct adl_tag {};
00016 
00017 template <class Archive, class Serializable>
00018 struct ptr_serialization_support;
00019 
00020 // We could've just used ptr_serialization_support, above, but using
00021 // it with only a forward declaration causes vc6/7 to complain about a
00022 // missing instantiate member, even if it has one.  This is just a
00023 // friendly layer of indirection.
00024 template <class Archive, class Serializable>
00025 struct _ptr_serialization_support
00026   : ptr_serialization_support<Archive,Serializable>
00027 {
00028     typedef int type;
00029 };
00030 
00031 #ifdef __SUNPRO_CC
00032 
00033 template<int N>
00034 struct counter : counter<N-1> {};
00035 template<>
00036 struct counter<0> {};
00037 
00038 template<class Serializable>
00039 void instantiate_ptr_serialization(Serializable* s, int, adl_tag) {
00040     instantiate_ptr_serialization(s, counter<20>());
00041 }
00042 
00043 template<class Archive>
00044 struct get_counter {
00045     static const int value = sizeof(adjust_counter(counter<20>()));
00046     typedef counter<value> type;
00047     typedef counter<value - 1> prior;
00048     typedef char (&next)[value+1];
00049 };
00050 
00051 char adjust_counter(counter<0>);
00052 template<class Serializable>
00053 void instantiate_ptr_serialization(Serializable*, counter<0>) {}
00054 
00055 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_REGISTER_ARCHIVE(Archive)                     \
00056 namespace boost { namespace archive { namespace detail {                  \
00057     get_counter<Archive>::next adjust_counter(get_counter<Archive>::type);\
00058     template<class Serializable>                                          \
00059     void instantiate_ptr_serialization(Serializable* s,                   \
00060         get_counter<Archive>::type) {                                     \
00061         ptr_serialization_support<Archive, Serializable> x;               \
00062         instantiate_ptr_serialization(s, get_counter<Archive>::prior());  \
00063     }\
00064 }}}
00065 
00066 
00067 #else
00068 
00069  // This function gets called, but its only purpose is to participate
00070  // in overload resolution with the functions declared by
00071  // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_REGISTER_ARCHIVE, below.
00072 // This function gets called, but its only purpose is to participate
00073 // in overload resolution with the functions declared by
00074 // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_REGISTER_ARCHIVE, below.
00075 template <class Serializable>
00076 void instantiate_ptr_serialization(Serializable*, int, adl_tag ) {}
00077 
00078 // The function declaration generated by this macro never actually
00079 // gets called, but its return type gets instantiated, and that's
00080 // enough to cause registration of serialization functions between
00081 // Archive and any exported Serializable type.  See also:
00082 // boost/serialization/export.hpp
00083 # define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_REGISTER_ARCHIVE(Archive)                  \
00084 namespace boost { namespace archive { namespace detail {                \
00085                                                                         \
00086 template <class Serializable>                                           \
00087 BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME _ptr_serialization_support<Archive, Serializable>::type  \
00088 instantiate_ptr_serialization( Serializable*, Archive*, adl_tag );              \
00089                                                                         \
00090 }}}
00091 #endif
00092 }}} // namespace boost::archive::detail
00093 
00094 #endif // BOOST_ARCHIVE_DETAIL_INSTANTIATE_SERIALIZE_DWA2006521_HPP
